p.s: Sonnet 65 by William Shakespeare is one of the sonnets that is written to the Fair Youth, a beautiful young man whoswhose identity is unknown until today.
But it is not addressing to a you, in Shakespear'sShakespeare's language a thou, as the other plays that are written to the Fair Youth.
The sonnet has four quartainsquatrains with four lines and one couplet with two lines.
It is written in iambic pentrameter.
In the quartainsquatrains ShakespearShakespeare uses a crossrhyme and in the couplet a pairrhyme.

The sonnet deals with the issue that nothing can resist time because everything that is existing on earth as a mortal but theirthere is a soulutionsolution because the youth can survive in the sonnets.
